props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- --- ## **Core Topics & Concepts Summary** ### **1. Flask (Python Web Framework)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Routing & Views**: - `@app.route('/path')` decorator to define endpoints. - Dynamic routes: `/` (e.g., `/user/`). - Trailing slashes: Flask redirects `/about` → `/about/` if defined with a trailing slash. - HTTP methods: `@app.route('/path', methods=['GET', 'POST'])`. - **Request Handling**: - `request.args` (for query parameters in GET requests). - `request.form` (for form data in POST requests). - `request.json` (for JSON payloads). - `abort()` to return HTTP error codes (e.g., `abort(404)`). - **Templates (Jinja2)**: - Template inheritance: `{% extends "base.html" %}`. - Blocks: `{% block content %}{% endblock %}`. - Variables: `{{ variable }}`. - Conditionals/loops: `{% if %}`, `{% for %}`. - Static files: `url_for('static', filename='style.css')`. - **Flask-SQLAlchemy (ORM)**: - Model definition: ```python class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(50)) ``` - Relationships: ```python class Author(db.Model): books = db.relationship('Book', backref='author', lazy='dynamic', cascade="all, delete") ``` - `lazy='dynamic'`: Returns a query object (not loaded immediately). - `cascade="all, delete"`: Deletes child records when parent is deleted. - Queries: ```python User.query.filter_by(name='Alice').first() db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() ``` - **Flask-RESTful**: - Resource classes: ```python class UserResource(Resource): def get(self, user_id): return {"user": user_id} api.add_resource(UserResource, '/user/') ``` - HTTP methods: `get`, `post`, `put`, `delete`. - Request parsing: ```python parser = reqparse.RequestParser() parser.add_argument('name', required=True) args = parser.parse_args() ``` - **Error Handling**: - Custom error pages: ```python @app.errorhandler(404) def not_found(e): return "Page not found", 404 ``` - `abort(400)` for bad requests. #### **Key Equations/Code Snippets:** 1. **Dynamic Route**: ```python @app.route('/user/') def show_user(username): return f"User: {username}" ``` 2. **Query Parameters**: ```python @app.route('/search') def search(): query = request.args.get('q') return f"Searching for: {query}" ``` 3. **SQLAlchemy Relationship**: ```python class Parent(db.Model): children = db.relationship('Child', backref='parent', lazy='dynamic') ``` 4. **Flask-RESTful Resource**: ```python class ItemResource(Resource): def get(self, item_id): return {"item": item_id} ``` --- ### **2. HTML/CSS/JavaScript** #### **Key Concepts:** - **HTML**: - Semantic tags: `
`, `
`, `
`. - Forms: ```html
``` - Inline vs. block elements: - Block: `
`, `

`, `

` (start on new line). - Inline: ``, ``, `` (flow with text). - **CSS**: - Selectors: `#id`, `.class`, `element`. - Box model: `margin`, `border`, `padding`, `content`. - Flexbox/Grid for layouts. - Example: ```css #mybox { border: 1px solid black; font-weight: bold; } ``` - **JavaScript**: - DOM manipulation: ```javascript document.getElementById("myId").style.fontWeight = "bold"; ``` - Event handling: ```javascript ``` - Asynchronous JS: `fetch()`, `Promise`, `async/await`. #### **Key Equations/Code Snippets:** 1. **CSS Border**: ```css #box { border: 1px solid black; /* Correct syntax */ } ``` 2. **JavaScript DOM Update**: ```javascript document.getElementById("txt1").style.fontWeight = "bold"; ``` 3. **HTML Form**: ```html
``` --- ### **3. Git & Version Control** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Basic Commands**: - `git init`: Initialize a repo. - `git clone `: Clone a remote repo. - `git add `: Stage changes. - `git commit -m "message"`: Commit changes. - `git push`: Push to remote. - `git pull`: Pull from remote. - `git merge `: Merge branches. - `git checkout `: Switch branches. - **Branching**: - Create: `git branch `. - Switch: `git checkout `. - Merge: `git checkout main; git merge feature`. - **Conflict Resolution**: - Merge conflicts occur when two branches modify the same line. - Resolve manually in the file, then `git add` and `git commit`. - **Remote Repositories**: - `git remote add origin `. - `git push -u origin main`. #### **Key Workflows:** 1. **Merge Feature Branches**: ```bash git checkout main git merge feature1 git merge feature2 ``` 2. **Pull Before Push**: ```bash git pull origin main # Avoid conflicts git push origin main ``` --- ### **4. Testing (Pytest)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Unit Testing**: - Test individual functions/methods. - Naming convention: `test_*.py` or `*_test.py`. - Functions named `test_*` are auto-discovered. - **Fixtures**: - Reusable test data/setup: ```python @pytest.fixture def sample_data(): return {"key": "value"} ``` - **Markers**: - Categorize tests: ```python @pytest.mark.unit def test_function(): assert 1 + 1 == 2 ``` - Run specific markers: ```bash pytest -m "unit" ``` - **Assertions**: - `assert , "error message"`. - **Mocking**: - Replace dependencies with mock objects (e.g., `unittest.mock`). #### **Key Commands:** 1. **Run All Tests**: ```bash pytest ``` 2. **Run Specific Marker**: ```bash pytest -m "unit or integration" ``` 3. **Verbose Output**: ```bash pytest -v ``` --- ### **5. HTTP & Web Concepts** #### **Key Concepts:** - **HTTP Methods**: - `GET`: Retrieve data (idempotent, cacheable). - `POST`: Submit data (non-idempotent). - `PUT`: Update/replace data (idempotent). - `DELETE`: Remove data (idempotent). - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK`: Success. - `201 Created`: Resource created. - `400 Bad Request`: Client error. - `404 Not Found`: Resource missing. - `500 Internal Server Error`: Server error. - **GET vs. POST**: - `GET`: Data in URL (visible, bookmarked, cached). - `POST`: Data in body (hidden, not cached). - **RESTful APIs**: - Stateless, resource-based. - Endpoints: `/users`, `/users/`. - Use HTTP methods for CRUD: - `GET /users`: List users. - `POST /users`: Create user. - `PUT /users/1`: Update user 1. - `DELETE /users/1`: Delete user 1. #### **Key Examples:** 1. **Flask Route for REST**: ```python @app.route('/users', methods=['GET', 'POST']) def users(): if request.method == 'POST': # Create user pass else: # List users pass ``` 2. **cURL Commands**: ```bash curl -X POST http://example.com/users -d "name=Alice" ``` --- ### **6. Performance & Networking** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Bandwidth vs. Latency**: - Bandwidth: Data transfer rate (e.g., 5 Mbps = 5 megabits per second). - Latency: Delay (e.g., ping time). - **Download Time Calculation**: - Time = File Size / Bandwidth. - Example: 10 MB file at 5 Mbps: - 10 MB = 80 Mb (1 byte = 8 bits). - Time = 80 Mb / 5 Mbps = 16 seconds. - **Caching**: - Store frequently accessed data (e.g., `Cache-Control` headers). - **CDNs**: - Distribute content globally to reduce latency. #### **Key Equation:** 1. **Download Time**: \[ \text{Time (seconds)} = \frac{\text{File Size (bits)}}{\text{Bandwidth (bits/second)}} \] Example: 10 MB = 80 Mb → 80 Mb / 5 Mbps = 16 s. --- ### **7. Software Testing Types** | **Test Type** | **Focus Area** | |------------------------|-----------------------------------------------| | Unit Testing | Smallest units (functions/methods). | | Integration Testing | Interaction between components/modules. | | System Testing | Entire system in a full environment. | | System Testing Automation | Automated end-to-end tests. | | User Acceptance Testing| Real-world validation by end-users. | --- ### **8. Nielsen’s Usability Heuristics** 1. **Visibility of System Status**: Keep users informed (e.g., loading spinners). 2. **Match Between System and Real World**: Use familiar language. 3. **User Control and Freedom**: Support undo/redo. 4. **Consistency and Standards**: Follow platform conventions. 5. **Error Prevention**: Validate inputs early. 6. **Recognition Over Recall**: Minimize memory load (e.g., dropdowns). 7. **Flexibility and Efficiency**: Shortcuts for experts. 8. **Aesthetic and Minimalist Design**: Avoid clutter. 9. **Help Users Recognize/Recover from Errors**: Clear error messages. 10. **Help and Documentation**: Provide guides. --- ### **9. Logging** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Log Levels** (Python `logging` module): - `DEBUG`: Detailed info for debugging. - `INFO`: Confirmation that things are working. - `WARNING`: Potential issues. - `ERROR`: Serious problems. - `CRITICAL`: Fatal errors. - **Log Format**: ```python logging.basicConfig( level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s' ) ``` - **Example**: ```python logging.error("Negative number provided: %d", num) ``` --- ### **10. Deployment & Accessibility** - **Localhost vs. Network Access**: - `127.0.0.1`: Local machine only. - `0.0.0.0`: Accessible on the local network (if firewall allows). - **Flask Debug Mode**: - `app.run(debug=True)`: Auto-reloads on code changes. - **Template Folders**: - Default: `templates/`. - Custom: `app = Flask(__name__, template_folder='custom_templates')`. --- --- ## **Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** ### **1. Flask Core Concepts** ```mermaid graph TD A[Flask] --> B[Routing] A --> C[Templates] A --> D[Request Handling] A --> E[Database ORM] A --> F[RESTful APIs] B --> B1["@app.route('/path')"] B --> B2["Dynamic Routes: /"] B --> B3["HTTP Methods: GET, POST, etc."] C --> C1["Jinja2 Syntax: {{ }} {% %}"] C --> C2["Template Inheritance"] C --> C3["Static Files"] D --> D1["request.args"] D --> D2["request.form"] D --> D3["request.json"] D --> D4["abort()"] E --> E1["SQLAlchemy Models"] E --> E2["Relationships: db.relationship"] E --> E3["Queries: filter_by(), first()"] F --> F1["Flask-RESTful Resource"] F --> F2["Request Parsing"] F --> F3["HTTP Status Codes"] ``` ### **2. Git Workflow** ```mermaid graph TD A[Git] --> B[Local Operations] A --> C[Remote Operations] A --> D[Branching] B --> B1["git init"] B --> B2["git add"] B --> B3["git commit"] B --> B4["git status"] C --> C1["git clone"] C --> C2["git push"] C --> C3["git pull"] C --> C4["git remote"] D --> D1["git branch"] D --> D2["git checkout"] D --> D3["git merge"] D --> D4["Conflict Resolution"] ``` ### **3. Testing Pyramid** ```mermaid graph TD A[Testing] --> B[Unit Tests] A --> C[Integration Tests] A --> D[System Tests] A --> E[Acceptance Tests] B --> B1["pytest"] B --> B2["Fixtures"] B --> B3["Mocking"] C --> C1["Component Interaction"] C --> C2["API Contracts"] D --> D1["End-to-End"] D --> D2["User Scenarios"] E --> E1["User Acceptance Testing"] E --> E2["Beta Testing"] ``` ### **4. HTTP Methods & Status Codes** ```mermaid graph TD A[HTTP] --> B[Methods] A --> C[Status Codes] B --> B1["GET: Retrieve Data"] B --> B2["POST: Create Data"] B --> B3["PUT: Update Data"] B --> B4["DELETE: Remove Data"] C --> C1["2xx: Success"] C --> C2["4xx: Client Error"] C --> C3["5xx: Server Error"] C1 --> C1a["200 OK"] C1 --> C1b["201 Created"] C2 --> C2a["400 Bad Request"] C2 --> C2b["404 Not Found"] C3 --> C3a["500 Internal Server Error"] ``` ### **5. HTML/CSS/JS Relationship** ```mermaid graph TD A[Frontend] --> B[HTML] A --> C[CSS] A --> D[JavaScript] B --> B1["Structure:
